titles: Ukraine war: Dozens feared dead after bomb hits school
descriptions: A Ukrainian official says 60 people may be dead after an air strike on a village school in Luhansk.

titles: 'We tried not to watch' - escapees recount terror of Russian-occupied Izyum
descriptions: Two women recall what happened when Russia took over a strategically-important city in the Donbas.

titles: War in Ukraine: Zelensky WW2 speech accuses Russia of Nazi atrocities
descriptions: The Ukrainian leader compares Russia's invasion of his country to wartime Nazi bombings.

titles: Ros Atkins on... Why 9 May matters to Russia
descriptions: Ros Atkins explains why Victory Day is such an important date in Russia.

titles: Two held in manhunt for axe attackers who killed three Israelis
descriptions: Israeli police say the Palestinians were found hiding in bush near Elad where the attack took place.

titles: EasyJet to take out seats so it can fly with fewer crew
descriptions: The airline plans to remove a row of seats so that it can fly with fewer cabin crew on board.

titles: Sri Lanka: The protests unifying a nation where ethnic fault lines run deep
descriptions: Unprecedented protests in Colombo are unifying a nation where ethnic fault lines run deep.

titles: Hong Kong's John Lee: Ex-security chief becomes new leader
descriptions: John Lee's appointment is being seen as a move by China to tighten its grip on the city.

titles: New Mexico wildfire: Huge blaze could worsen this weekend
descriptions: "Historic" extreme weather likely to stoke New Mexico fire, which is already the size of Chicago.

titles: Kentucky Derby: 80-1 outsider Rich Strike pulls off historic upset
descriptions: Rich Strike, a 80-1 outsider, won the race despite only being brought in after a horse dropped out.

titles: UK YouTuber Benjamin Rich quizzed and fined at Russian space centre
descriptions: Bald and Bankrupt vlogger Benjamin Rich says he was questioned by Russian police in Kazakhstan.

titles: Brazil's Lula launches presidential campaign
descriptions: The former Brazilian president says he wants to unite the country and defend its democracy.

titles: Ukraine war: Returning to the place my father was killed
descriptions: As Vadim and his father tried to rescue their dogs, they were fired upon by a convoy they believe was Russian.

titles: Ukraine war: 'If this is true, then I am also a Nazi'
descriptions: Holocaust survivors in the Ukrainian city of Uman feel insulted by Russian claims to be fighting Nazis.

titles: Viewpoint: Putin now faces only different kinds of defeat
descriptions: Russia's Victory Day parade won't represent any sort of victory over Ukraine, writes defence analyst Michael Clarke.

titles: KwaZulu-Natal floods: The South African family who lost nine children
descriptions: Mass funerals are held in South Africa after the country's most deadly natural disaster.

titles: Philippines election: 'Politicians hire me to spread fake stories'
descriptions: Voters in the Philippines presidential election are facing an onslaught of online lies.

titles: Fergal Keane: How I found a way to live with PTSD
descriptions: The BBC correspondent, who was diagnosed with PTSD in 2008, explores the effects of the condition and how it can be treated.

titles: Who is Alina Kabaeva, Putin's alleged girlfriend?
descriptions: The EU is proposing to sanction Alina Kabaeva, an ex-gymnast turned media boss close to President Vladimir Putin.

titles: Ukraine war: Bono sings with soldier in Kyiv metro station
descriptions: The U2 frontman was seen singing at a downtown metro station covering the hit track Stand by Me.

titles: Ukraine war: Rebuilt Kyiv railway bridge a symbol of hope
descriptions: A railway bridge close to Kyiv has been rebuilt, just a month after it was destroyed by Russian attacks.

titles: The return of California's butterflies
descriptions: Efforts to protect these beautiful insects include driving electric tractors and hand-rearing them in a lab.

titles: Acid attack survivors in Mexico: 'Justice is not enough'
descriptions: Carmen Sanchez launched her foundation in Mexico to help survivors of attacks rebuild their lives.

titles: Australia election: Welcome to Durack, a seat six times bigger than Britain
descriptions: Australians head to the polls on 21 May - and in Durack, it means a massive logistical effort.
